website_summaries.verdict: Shades that slide down over your window and come in different sizes to fit your car.
pros: Each set comes with 2 shades and is available in medium (23.7 inches to 38 inches) and large (24.4 inches to 40.2 inches) sizes
You can still roll down your window with the shades on, so they can also help block bugs
cons: Can be hard to see through and can make noise in the wind while driving

customer_reviews.title: Fits just right!
customer_reviews.text: These shades slipped right on without any hassle and fit like there were made for my vehicle. (Chevy Equinox) Good sun blockage and privacy as well. Impressed!
customer_reviews.author: West Coast girl on the East Coast

customer_reviews.title: Not Just for Babies!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for our Honda CRV. I had been having problems with migraines and photophobia. We had a long drive ahead and bought these ahead of time. They fit very snuggly and I heard very little noise from the fabric vibrating against the car. They did a great job of cutting down the amount of sunlight in the car.
customer_reviews.author: Cassandra

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Had to send back. Did not fit my toyota corolla which is a small car
customer_reviews.author: Angela Ruffino

customer_reviews.title: Love them but flawed
customer_reviews.text: Fits my 2019 kia forte perfectly. Love that two come for the price. Love the amount of sun they block. Love how easy they are to install. Quality seems great. However, you can't see out of the driver side back window. Totally unsafe.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: great multiuse!
customer_reviews.text: I love these!!! In addition to car sun protection for my child I found other great purposed for them. They allow me to open the window some while having the privacy to nurse my child discretely. This also is bug protection while windows were down while watching an outdoor movie. I will be sending them to a friend who is expecting soon too! Side note: do not attempt to remove or open window in freezing weather, it will tear if stuck to a frozen window. Not my best moment. Will have to order more now!
customer_reviews.author: H

customer_reviews.title: Great product for road trips and people with kids in back seat.
customer_reviews.text: Got this for a road trip and love them. You get 2. I would advise for back windows only, too dark for front windows-they do limit visibility. They block more light than traditional stick-on shades so they keep the car cooler also so that was an added benefit. Fit easily on my Honda CRV. There was some slack which made a little noise but with adjustment and closing door so extra fabric was on inside it was very minimal. SO much better than traditional shades especially since they cover entire window!.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good sun screen
customer_reviews.text: I find it's very convenient for what I bought it for. My baby was around 2-3 weeks old and I needed a screen for my window to shield him from the sun, I saw this and thought I'd try it. I like that it can be washed and is removable. It does an execellent job of blocking the sun out! However it fits over your window like a cover and so it does flap in the breeze on the outside of the window, other than that I'm glad I bought it for my baby :)
customer_reviews.author: rlc22Top Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Well made, but doesn't cover the height
customer_reviews.text: I have a 2014 Subaru Forester that I purchased these for the back windows. They seem to be a nice quality. However, although the width fits (window is 34" - these mediums said they cover to 38") they are at least 2" short height-wise. I think the large would probably have fit better but there was no option to pick large. It would have been helpful if the height of each size was listed in the description so one would know if both dimension work. I purchased these for a road trip and will be using them to allow air in while sleeping in the back, so even though they are short they should still work for my purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Jane T.

customer_reviews.title: From 5 to 1
customer_reviews.text: Ordered 2 more since the last ones faded and this time I got some super thin ones with Velcro?!? Not only are they incredibly thin, they came torn. Extremely disappointed. Ahhh perfect. My tint job has faded and the sun always shines right where the suction cup shades don’t cover. These are perfect! Definitely only for the back windows though. Edit: after driving with the windows down with them on I’d say they did rather well. I wish they were a smidge snugger but they performed well. My two under 5 loved the shade! I drive a Kia spectra and they’re only a smidge loose at the top. Nothing major.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly & Rene (But mostly Kelly)

customer_reviews.title: Repeat customer disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This is the 4th set I have ordered of these sun shades (for different vehicles not because they were breaking). I ordered them through the same link from the same company and this last set I ordered was COMPLETELY DIFFERENT from the three previous sets. Much cheaper quality with pulls in the fabric, mostly sheer with hardly any sun protection. After raving about these to everyone I know I was highly disappointed when I was buying this last set as a gift. I was embarrassed to even give them.
customer_reviews.author: Linderrrrr

customer_reviews.title: Blocks blind spot
customer_reviews.text: Works amazing for blocking light. My rating is based on it folding in the rubber around my window from the elastic around it and when you use it on the driver's side it completely blocks your view of your blind spot because of the angle you are looking back it's pitch black. Also the wind kind of stretches out the fabric a little on the outside but you can't hear any flapping. I will still be using it on the passenger side.
customer_reviews.author: Coulter/LeBlanc

customer_reviews.title: Looks terrible
customer_reviews.text: I have no idea why these have good reviews, I feel tricked. They were too small for our Buick Enclave, couldn’t get them on at all... and so I put them on the backdoor of a Mazda 3 and it’s so ridiculously baggy; someone thought our window was broke and it was a black trash bag over it and I had to explain what it was when they asked me about it. It has so much extra fabric all bunched up and when you shut the door the fabric flops all around and the top of the door and then hangs down
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Best sun shade!
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought the suction on pull down type but the kept falling off, then I bought the static cling ones and they either fell off or didn’t cover enough. I found these and love them. Quick on and off, no need to worry if your window is clean for it to stick. Since it is like bag over your window you get two layers of protection. The sun still comes through but not blazing like before. It’s nice that you can open the window and still have protection! I bought medium for my 2012 Tiguan, fits tight with only a paper thin gap at bottom, prob could have gotten large and had extra room to give
customer_reviews.author: eiluj724

customer_reviews.title: Love these things
customer_reviews.text: Love these things, bought a set for my friends jeep and now they are the must have item around the campground, perfect for those of us who sleep in our vehicles, air flow and privacy.
customer_reviews.author: LeeA

customer_reviews.title: Obstruction of vision
customer_reviews.text: These are great, but here’s the deal. They make it almost impossible to see out of your back windows. They do serve their purpose of shading the baby though. I haven’t had any issues with him being hot or uncomfortable with the sun in his face since I installed these but beware they obstruct your vision.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Allen

customer_reviews.title: Fits 2019 Crosstrek
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for camping in the cai and they did not disappiont. They fit my Subaru Crosstrek *almost* perfectly . they very slight slack isn't bothersome - even when driving at 80+ mph, I didn't notice any vibrating except during a gust of crosswind. Absolutely worked for my purposes. Drove 1800 miles with them installed and didn't notice any tearing, so I think they will last several long trips as long as I'm careful not to stab the corner of the door through the mesh.
customer_reviews.author: Karina alonso

customer_reviews.title: Much better than the rolling suction shades!
customer_reviews.text: These work pretty well. They fit good over the rear windows of a 2019 Mazda CX-5. I wish it were easier to figure out which side faces in or out. I had to do some some experimenting. I like being able to have the window down to give my baby plenty of air in these warm months. Shade is good. I don't understand the reviews of people saying they're dark or cause issues with driving. Maybe they're not used to driving with tint. I've had no problems seeing objects day or night with them on. I plan to purchase another set for the grandparents' car.
customer_reviews.author: D C

customer_reviews.title: Perfect shade
customer_reviews.text: It actually works very well. It blocks your blind spot at night if you drive a small or mid size sedan like I do. But during the day it’s great, it keeps the sun off my black leather seat in the high desert and that makes a huge difference in the temperature of the car when you first get in. I have two babies in the back seat and they didnt sleep much in the back seat because of the light (even with my limo tints) but now it’s really comfortable for them and the snooze and play without having the sun on their faces. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: RAIN ROD

customer_reviews.title: Didn't like it
customer_reviews.text: They go on very easily and I like the IDEA behind them. . .but in reality they are too dark to see out of properly while driving and scanning your blind spots to switch lanes. Since they're universal there is extra fabric too that you can hear blowing in the wind. I had them on for less than 24 hours before removing them. Sucks because I like the potential they have to work but they just didn't work for us.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fits like a sock over the door
customer_reviews.text: Fits like a sock over the door, My baby is well shaded. It is a bit dark but I can still see if there is a car in my blind spot. All in all I am incredibly happy with this purchase. Also, my husband scoffed at it because he was convinced it would be torn to shreds on the outside, so far it's been through a road trip, 2 thunderstorms and a dust storm and the outside looks like brand new still even weeks later.
customer_reviews.author: tabitha

customer_reviews.title: LOVE
customer_reviews.text: Love these window shades. My daughter would always complain about the sun and the simple store bought ones were not working. They only kept out some of the sun and when you rolled down the windows they popped off. These have solved all of those issues. They fit on my 2014 Infiniti Q50 perfectly. My daughter no longer has any complaints about the sun and as an added bonus she loves that she can roll down her windows and not worry about bugs coming inside. They dont roll up and are great quality. I dont take them off when I go through the car wash and they hold up well.
customer_reviews.author: Briana Raghunandan

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT for kids in the car on a hot day!
customer_reviews.text: This is the PERFECT item for kids in the car! My kids are always falling asleep and when the sun beats down on them I feel terrible. They start to sweat and then I’m struggling to find a shady spot for them. These shades are AMAZING!! Slides on like a pillow case, keeps out the bugs, blocks out the the sun, and the air stills flows through with the window easily! I went and bought a second set for my mother in law after she saw how easy and awesome they were to use! I’ve also already recommended this product to many of my friends with kids. You just CANT beat this price for such a great product!
customer_reviews.author: Desiree

customer_reviews.title: Best thing over found for babies
customer_reviews.text: Much better than window clings! Added bonus of being able to crack my windows without worry about bugs or thieves (it’s not obvious your window is down unless you really look). They aren’t a risk of becoming a dangerous projectile in a wreck. They can sometimes slide up in my Hyundai Tucson, leaving a small sliver of window showing, but overall all highly recommend then. That small inconvenience is much better than the hassle of every other window shade I have tried.
customer_reviews.author: dlschess

customer_reviews.title: A Shade for All Kinds
customer_reviews.text: This shade is absolutely perfect. The seller provided the minimum and maximum dimensions so if you are unsure, just measure your car window. Two shades come in the pack so you can have coverage on both sides of your vehicle. The material is breathable mesh so you can roll down the windows, your child can enjoy the air, and still be protected from the sun. You can even wash them if they get dirty from the outside elements. A great buy for me at a beyond reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Roaringqueen

customer_reviews.title: Great coverage and easy installation
customer_reviews.text: This is my fourth and by far favorite sun blocking product I’ve tried. Most window cling versions only cover part of the window, but this product covers the entire window and is dark enough to make a real difference. It blends in pretty well with my car and has held up with me taking it on and off. It slips over the window quickly like a sock and the elastic has kept tight. The only drawback is when I try to check my blind spot (driver’s side) the angle makes it too opaque and difficult to see through.
customer_reviews.author: Halfbreed

customer_reviews.title: Great buy for the price
customer_reviews.text: It definitely blocks out the sun. It's way better than having a curtain/shade that sticks to the inside of the window, bcuz it end up falling off, especially if you accidentally roll down the window. With these, you can roll down your windows w/o worrying about needing to take off/put back the shade. It doesn't look the best, but if you keep adjusting it here and there. It looks fine. I'm going to buy another one for my other car.
customer_reviews.author: jojo

customer_reviews.title: Best window shade I’ve ever seen!
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical with these, but I’ll be ordering 2 more. They click more sunlight than I imagined, but still breathe. They fit on my hubbys Infiniti g35, though I thought they would be too small, and they are safer than the alternatives. As a paramedic, in a crash I can tell you everything goes flying. Including the bar that holds those other window shades. Plus, I imagine if the window shattered or had to be broken due to a lock in, there would be at least some protection from the debris... 10/10 This is my favorite baby purchase this time around.
customer_reviews.author: Alice

customer_reviews.title: Does a good job at sun protection, but looks bad and can cause blind spots
customer_reviews.text: The fabric itself is decent quality and its nice to be able to roll down your window, but that wasn't enough to give it more than 3 stars and a partial recommendation. I like how well it did at providing sun protection to our toddler, but it was too small for our SUV and too big for our sedan to look good. I ended up having to take it off of the SUV because of the huge blind spot it created whenever I went to change lanes. This is a good way to provide sun protection but I would pay more to have a vehicle specific shade, if not at least vehicle type specific.
customer_reviews.author: Nik

customer_reviews.title: Better than suction cups or cling-ons
customer_reviews.text: This was extremely easy to install. My husband and I are very happy that we can still roll down the window. There’s no fuss. Wind can still come through and nothing can fly in! It’s not such thick fabric, so I can still see through it but it blocks out enough light. It also covers the entire window. The velcro attachments made it snug but we could have not used them, just nice to have extra enforcements though. Fight perfectly on our 2011 Toyota RAV4 windows.
customer_reviews.author: N and J M

customer_reviews.title: Great for Summer/warmer weather
customer_reviews.text: Fit nicely on the rear windows of my 2003 Impala. I don't think they will work well for in winter since I need to be able to scrape snow and ice off my windows (in MN). However, they have been great through the summer. I like that I can open the windows to allow a cross breeze while parked and not let so many bugs in. They help keep the cab somewhat cooler even with all the windows rolled up, So they must be blocking some solar heat.
customer_reviews.author: Tresa R, MN

customer_reviews.title: Buy these if you have children! It works!
customer_reviews.text: Having been using for a few days now and i love it! It really does keep the car cooler and dealing with az weather this is a major plus! I have a toddler and 2 newborn babies and these shades keep out the sun significantly. They all sleep comfortably with no sun in their eyes. I have a nissan altima and these shades fit perfectly. I would definitely recommend these shades especially if you have children. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Lovemypups

customer_reviews.title: Good, but potentially dangerous
customer_reviews.text: I've only been using these for the last month, but I have noticed a difference in how hot my child seat is after coming back to the car after work. It has made a considerable difference in my backseat. However the visibility while driving is next to nothing if you need to look in your blind spots or check around your car before changing lanes. Is actually quite dangerous. As for durability they don't look very durable and I can already tell when having to take them on and off that they mate are pretty easily but so far they are holding up.
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy
customer_reviews.text: Has little velcro handles? if that is what they are. I almost ripped it off first try. They are very Flimsy so be carefull. Did not fit my RAV4 Front Windows. Missed by an inch and no more stretch. Once you reached the end you have reached the end. Need to be more specific with sizes otherwise this is a great IDEA. Just cheap idea for the time being. Make them in sized for, & shaped for, leave a little extra to get a good grip and these would be awesome. but for now... Ahhhhhh
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Pretty tight on a Kia Forte
customer_reviews.text: Pretty tight on a Kia Forte. Hoping it doesn't mess up my car. It's supposed to rain today, so I will update how it holds up in the rain. My fear is that the inside will get wet because of it. Update: I had to take away a star :( It has been fine in the rain, but I had to take them off one day this week and when I put them back on, it is so saggy and looks horrible!!!!! So disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla H.

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these because the little safety first retractable sun flap did not over enough to block out the sun. These are like insta-tint. I would only recommend using one where the child is seated, because when I used both the one on the drivers side kinda impaired my vision when I would do a blind spot look back. It’s a wee bit too dark and gets worse when wet. I tried them on a rainy day. However, they are worth the purchase because it blocks out the sun for your wee one and keeps that spot cooler.
customer_reviews.author: Lady Redbone

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn’t recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Very unhappy. My car doors are the exact shape and size as those oictured, but the shade will not stay on it. It’s way too loose, and flaps when driving because so much hangs off. I have a typical sedan, with doors like those in the photos. I wouldn’t recommend these whatsoever. It also makes it incredibly difficult if the driver needs to see out of the window in the back.
customer_reviews.author: MamaE

customer_reviews.title: Very good shading
customer_reviews.text: We had bought 2 other different types of shading for the rear windows of our car, but they were the kind that uses suction to hold to the glass and were always falling and they weren't giving shade were we needed it. We also bought the rolling type and also didn't cover the area we needed. This are like T-shirts to your car doors so every bit of the window is covered with a nice shade, they do not fall off and a plus is you can roll your windows down to let the air in without losing the shade
customer_reviews.author: Graciela Leal

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I love this shade. My daughter was getting so much sun on her car seat. This thing is easy quick and blocks out sun. Make sure you pull it down far enough so it’s not bunch and you can see right through it. It doesn’t cause a blind spot. It'll be great when the weather cools down too and we can have the windows down I won’t worry about my daughter throwing anything outside or anything flying in at her. And It’s a great price for 2.
customer_reviews.author: epl

customer_reviews.title: Revised review, much happier now!
customer_reviews.text: These covers are great and the larger size does fit my Prius. They provide great coverage for my baby. I did have to roll the bottoms a few times, but they are perfect! Very pleased with customer service as well. They reached out to me after my bad experience and fixed it right away! Old review I was really disappointed that these did not fit my Prius. I checked reviews that said it would. I guess it was my bad for not going and measuring myself but I have a newborn and a million other things to do.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Hsu

customer_reviews.title: Fits weird. Flaps in the wind.
customer_reviews.text: Well I got it so my dog could get some shade and I can open the window without worrying about her getting too far out. However, after a white it stretches in the wind and you hear the small tapping of it and wonder what it is until you remind yourself of the damn things. Also, I have a '17 Kia forte, getting it over the shape of the window was annoying. And it's probably why it has extra mesh hanging at the top but even pulling it tight doesn't last long. It will still flap. I do like that I can open my windows to vent without worrying about someone getting in, momentarily at least.
customer_reviews.author: Bea Banda

customer_reviews.title: Discolored/yellow white paint
customer_reviews.text: Good fit on 2016 scion ia. However, I'm giving four stars because they came with hanging thread...not sure if just extra or something come unstitched. Big blind spots. Also, I'm waiting for seams to come undone but hoping they don't ***UPDATE*** 8 23 16 I'M NOT USING THIS ANYMORE. I NOTICED FOR SOME REASON MY THE WHITE PAINT ON MY DOOR WHICH WAS UNDER THE SHADE DISCOLORED AND YELLOWED FOR SOME WEIRD REASON WHILE USING THIS. ALSO THE FIT IS LOOSE... TOO MUCH SLACK. MAKE SURE THIS THING ISN'T DISCOLORING YOUR VEHICLES PAINT.! After taking them off, it looks or the discoloration went away. Sucks because I love this thing but don't want it to discolor my cars paint
customer_reviews.author: Real person, fake name

customer_reviews.title: Awesome. Works perfect. Buy it!
customer_reviews.text: I wish I would have bought this first over other sun shades. Works amazing! Easy to put over the window of my Nissan Versa, with plenty of extra room for a bigger window. Since it slides over the window you get basically double protection from the sun. Makes the backseat super shaded for my son. And helps keep it cool. And on the plus side my son can grab it or pull on it and it stays just fine, other sun shades would rip off the window. Would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan & Lanae Kirby

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I got these two years ago and I still use them. It keeps the car cooler, it is easy to install and wash. My kids still can look outside but best of all, no sun in their eyes. It fits nicely on my car windows and I like the fact that I can have the window open for a bit without any issues. As I mentioned that I have been using them for a while, they aren’t as snug on my window but still fit great!
customer_reviews.author: Malissa F

customer_reviews.title: Nissan Sentra
customer_reviews.text: Fits my Nissan Sentra back windows. Great alternative to a stick on shade for kiddos. I especially like that i can put the windows down and still have the kids in the shade, oppose to the stick on shades that either crumple up or fall off when putting rear Windows down. I deducted one star simply because i have to roll the bottom of the cover up several times to fit more snuggly, and still it is not 100% flat to the window, maybe like 90-95%. I love this, just wish it was slightly smaller to fit sedan rear Windows. It would fit an SUV much more snug.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful product!
customer_reviews.text: MEASURE YOUR WINDOWS! That’s the best way to figure out which size will work for you. I went with the smaller size that I knew would be snug at the bottom but it kept the top from being baggy. Awesome product! Let’s air in, keeps bugs and sun out and is super helpful when my son decides to try and throw a toy out the window. Cons: once it’s stretched and fitted to your window....that’s it. If you take it off, it doesn’t return to regular size and so you have to be careful to keep it on the same window. Took a star off for that.
customer_reviews.author: Angie

customer_reviews.title: Does what it says in the ugliest way possible
customer_reviews.text: The thing works quite well and doesn't have many downsides except that it's an eye sore. I have a super old car though, so I don't really care about what it looks like. However, if I had a nice new vehicle, I'd never be caught with this thing on my car. It does work though and you can't really hear it flap in the wind at all, so aside from the look of it on the outside you never really notice it.
customer_reviews.author: Leeman

customer_reviews.title: Good but hard to see through while driving
customer_reviews.text: I love the concept of this window shade. I drive a Subaru Outback and it fits great. I love that I can roll down the back windows and the pups and my kid are securely inside, but can still enjoy the breeze. I'm giving this product three stars though because the shade behind the drivers side door blacks out the field of view. My husband hates driving my car now because he has to really crank his head to look around the shade to see the blind spot. It's impossible to see through. If I find another option that is a little safer, I will definitely replace this one.
customer_reviews.author: Tori

customer_reviews.title: Ordered twice got 2 different products.
customer_reviews.text: So I ordered this twice. The first set I got have been great. They fit really well, stay in place, and keep it noticeably cooler. The second time it took forever to get them, they are made of a different material that is thinner and not as dark. They also don’t fit as well (but are also on a different kind of car). Idk, they both work ok but I do not understand why they are so different.
customer_reviews.author: Mindy

customer_reviews.title: These are great!
customer_reviews.text: Placed on back windows to help with shading my 2 kids. We live in FL. Summers are brutal. These dramatically help shield the sun. I do have tinted windows, but without these shades the sun & heat was still awful. Using these keeps them shaded & keeps their car seats from getting hot. Easy to slip on the window/door. Good quality, has held up well & I've had them about 8 months.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Okay!
customer_reviews.text: So they’re super easy to put on, really block out the sun for sure. But if you have slightly tinted windows then you won’t be able to see out your windows to check your blind spot!! For now I have one on my rear passenger window next to my infant and I have just a regular one that you clip onto your window behind me for my 2 year old. Also my 2 year old didn’t like at all that she couldn’t see well from the window anymore. Just things to think about!
customer_reviews.author: Molly T

customer_reviews.title: Great sun shade/window tint!
customer_reviews.text: I love these! I got a new Nissan Rogue 2019 in standard and has no read window tinting. These are perfect! It took me a minute to figure out it goes over the entire inside and outside window...didnt see any instructions in pack. Fit almost perfectly with a little slack on bottom and makes no noise when driving. I can still see out but is dark enough to protect interior and provide shade for passengers.
customer_reviews.author: Ellie

customer_reviews.title: Like hosiery for your rear passenger windows
customer_reviews.text: Product works great at blocking sunlight into the back seat area. I use it for my son while he is riding in his car seat and the sun is out. It slides over my rear passenger windows very easily. The only qualm is that there is a low humming noise when driving at high rates of speeds on highways/freeways, but it isn't terribly bothersome. Other than that the only other concern I have is if the fabric catches a sharp edge on the door to snag the fabric and a run occurs, but I don't see that significantly impacting its ability to block the sun as its intended purpose.
customer_reviews.author: TexRex

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this with VERY low expectations. The idea of, essentially, a stocking that goes over the entire top half of the door seemed like a lousy solution. I was wrong. We use these daily on two different cars and love them. The fabric and elastic have held up for months with out any significant wear. They fit snugly over the door and stay in place well. They block out sunlight VERY well. And since they go over the entire door like a sock, you can roll down the window and still keep the sun out. I was pleasantly surprised at their quality and effectiveness. A+
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Does the trick!
customer_reviews.text: This is like a silky stretch material, feels like a dress slip. Slips over your car door, but it is a little too big for mine. Once you pull the door shut, it won't go anywhere, but there's a bit of loose flappy material to fuss with. It fits so much better than any other product I've found though, and you can roll the window down with it on to use like a bug screen. So I'm not complaining!
customer_reviews.author: CP

customer_reviews.title: Keeps the car cooler
customer_reviews.text: My car sits where the car gets extremely hot. I have the expanded thing in the front window, adding this was a GREAT idea. We live in Florida, and I am not sure you can drive with the windows dark. I take the pieces put it into the bag you gave and when I go to shopping mall or Drs It takes seconds to put on and come bak to a hot car but you will notbake in it. Thanks for this producct
customer_reviews.author: Nora

customer_reviews.title: Be Warned that product Window size range is smaller than stated.  No assistance from Seller.
customer_reviews.text: Product states that Window size accommodates up to 38" windows. This is not True. My Jeep has 35" Doors and the Product is so tight that its going to rip. I contacted product seller and asked if there was any chance they shipped me smaller product by mistake but I received a worthless reply that wasn't helpful. Too many other products for customers to select from so I DO NOT recommend this one.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Engle

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: We do a lot of road trips and this is perfect for us! I never take it off! It’s been a few months and it’s still going strong! Took less than a minute to put both of them on! I love that you can still roll the window down no problem and now I don’t have to awkwardly block the sun from my kids face with my hand. My shoulder that’s this product lol my toddler can now sleep on long rides and not be woken up by blinding sun.
customer_reviews.author: Alix Damron

customer_reviews.title: Bit too small. But they do work!
customer_reviews.text: I deducted a star for fit. Lol I have a Honda Pilot and getting these on was a chore...even ripped a hole in one of em. Yes, I tried them every which way. I thought these would be made of a more sheer stretchable fabric. Like a basketball jersey? But they are more a matte cotton fabric. However, even tho only 2/3 of my back windows are covered and it looks ridiculous, it does the job great! Lol doesn’t blocks my kids legs from the sun but at least their eyes are safe lol
customer_reviews.author: K. Rush

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these to help block the sun and heat to keep the interior of the car a little cooler and safer for my little ones. I've used them a few days and in love. They're incredibly easy to put on and take off. I can see through them while driving, still operate the windows and it even keeps bugs out. It's really helped with the temp in the car too. I've already recommended it to family members!
customer_reviews.author: Holly Ahearn

customer_reviews.title: Dont waste your money!!!!
customer_reviews.text: My 6 week old son doesnt like bright lights. So, i thought this would be awesome, a sun blocker and i could still roll the windows down! I have tinted back windows and it didnt hardly do anything! Plus, its not snug like the picture shows. Also, when driving you can hear it hitting againt the window. Super annoying! Need less to say i returned this item and got something else that actually works.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Hackbarth

customer_reviews.title: Great Fit, But Rubs Color
customer_reviews.text: Fits my 2016 subaru outback windows perfect! Amazing sun protection! But the black color rubs off, when installing my hands were completely dyed black. Would worry about rain causing streaks on paint.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Oscar

customer_reviews.title: I couldn't set the shade like on the picture as it can't stay straight at ...
customer_reviews.text: gives enough shades to the little one and still lets me see through it. I couldn't set the shade like on the picture as it can't stay straight at the base. I don't know how to explain but my window on one end is too slanted so it doesn't provide any grip for the elastic. I have a 2003 Camry. I can still make it stay but it's not as aesthetic as what I see on the pictures. It works though so all is good.
customer_reviews.author: RFL

customer_reviews.title: Fits like a glove
customer_reviews.text: Works awesome. I got this to protect my baby when we are out driving around. So, long story short I have a 2004 Kia Sorento LX and it fits my back doors like a glove. I don't know why everyone is complaining about them being too dark, I think they could actually be darker. I also like that I can roll down the windows and have a breeze blow through and not have to worry about bugs. Worth the money for the buy as far as I am concerned.
customer_reviews.author: Amar Rhom

customer_reviews.title: Nope, nope, nope.
customer_reviews.text: This does not fit universally😂 I bought it for my 2014 Toyota Corolla and it didn’t fit at all, my mom ended up ordering me one for me as I had just bought a new car, it also didn’t fit on my 2018 Honda Civic. It’s a great concept but should be made for specific vehicles, and not as a “universal” fit.
customer_reviews.author: Breanne

customer_reviews.title: It keeps the backseats pretty dark and cool for the kids
customer_reviews.text: I've used these window shades for 4 years with both my kids. It keeps the backseats pretty dark and cool for the kids. They can still see out of them and you can roll the window down to get them some air without having to worry about them chucking things out the window. They are resilient, do not tear or get punctured easily and can go through a car wash (I forgot to take them off one time) without getting hurt. I would highland recommend these shades!
customer_reviews.author: Stefenie & Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Does not work for Toyata Camry.
customer_reviews.text: Bought thinking it'd fit our Toyota Camry, however, it does not. May in the future will get a different car that it'll fit. Currently using still just have to hold it everytime you open and shut the door otherwise it springs off. Does a great job blocking the sun for my two little babies. Also like that I can still roll the window down which is why I bought it in the first place. To block the sun but still able to have the windows down.
customer_reviews.author: Kaylee

customer_reviews.title: What is the Velcro for?
customer_reviews.text: Both window shades seemed to be used and stretched out when I put them on both rear windows. One fit alright and the other one was stretched out like it was previously used and sent back from a different buyer. The video shows it’s clearer from the inside of the car when shade is on but it’s quite dark. Using them for the first time for a trip today so I’ll see how they hold up on the high way.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Hamel

customer_reviews.title: Great full coverage and so easy to use
customer_reviews.text: These worked better than I imagined. So easy to slide over your door and provides full coverage for the window. I do recommend these over those tiny window shades that stick to your window. The reason for 4 stars though is because it fits well over my car window but my husband's car window is bigger and after having these a few months they tend to constantly slide up the window and it's hard to keep them fully down on his car.
customer_reviews.author: Spork

customer_reviews.title: Hard to Use & Obstructs View
customer_reviews.text: There is little more ridiculous than hearing the window shade flapping as you drive down the highway. And good luck glancing out the window! It’s blocked completely creating a larger blind spot. The only use for these that I have found is for keeping the side of the car shaded when it’s parked.
customer_reviews.author: Polka Dot Pajamas

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Great for people with little ones. Sun protection and you can still open the window. Also provides a bug net so bugs can’t get in with the windows down. I have rainguards on my window and it slipped right over them fit my 01 Honda Civic great. Also if you don’t have tint makes it nice and dark in the back. You can see it on the outside of the car but it does not look bad at all. Worth the money ! I will never fight with the stick on sun guards again.
customer_reviews.author: Cupcake

customer_reviews.title: Clever and useful
customer_reviews.text: These work great for me. I highly recommend measuring your windows. The measurements provided are exactly the measurements of my window and the covers just fit. I bought one set that fit my front windows and a different set that fit my back windows. I sleep in my car now and then, and this makes it possible to leave the car windows open while keeping the bugs and stray glances out. I used them the last time I went camping and got lots of comments about them.
customer_reviews.author: Joy

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: I love that this completely covers the window. The previous square suction cup one I had let some sunlight in through the sides that would reach my baby. Although it was only a little bit of sunlight, over time driving in the same direction, it would begin to burn her and make her cry. I like that two covers are included, it's a great price for a 2-pack.
customer_reviews.author: Ziggy's Family

customer_reviews.title: Where has this been all my life?!
customer_reviews.text: I’m totally serious. I freaking love this thing! It actually comes in a set of 2. It is fantastic! Easy to put on and I haven’t taken it off 9/10 people don’t even notice it’s there. It dries quickly when rained on, but I haven’t tried it in snow or frozen weather. I probably won’t unless I’m taking a long trip. My kiddo can still see out the window and it’s not a danger to her if we get into a collision. I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: BjPace

customer_reviews.title: No Sun No Bugs
customer_reviews.text: These work great. I am so happy that I had found a product that not only covers the whole window to keep the sun out of my Childs, but also allows me to roll down the window for a nice breeze and keeps the bugs from getting in. Though there are reasons why I am giving these a four and not five star rating. They do not fit snug on my Kia Souls back windows, this allows the wind on the outside to tug on the fabric making it hard to see other cars when switching lanes. This may be due to the shape of the door for I have yet to try them on a different model of car.
customer_reviews.author: Jarvis

customer_reviews.title: JUST what The DOGS NEEDED!!
customer_reviews.text: My two Hound Girls go with me everywhere and LOVE the windows down. Although seat belted in better that some children, they still love to hang their heads out the windows, this allows them to feel the wind in their faces but I no longer worry about debris hitting them or getting in their eyes. I like it because I can leave my windows down at work and I don't worry about leaves or bugs waiting on me!
customer_reviews.author: Lottie K

customer_reviews.title: ***Star rating dropped on 2nd purchase***
customer_reviews.text: This product definitely doesn't what it need's to do and helps block sunlight for my kids. I have a '04 Ford Taurus and fits the door a little loose still, I was worried it wasn't going to fit. 5 star last year in 2018. Paid about $12 Update: 2nd purchase 2019 paid a little over $8- bought another set for my now Toyota 4runner and the quality definitely is not the same. These are now super cheap material and tear so easily at the seams but still get the job done that i need it for.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriela

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite sun visor for babes. I've used other kinds and dont like them. This one just slides over the top of the door with one side on the outside and the other on the inside of the car. So you have multiple layers of protection. Plus you can actually roll your window down and let air in while not blinding your kid.
customer_reviews.author: WCarney

customer_reviews.title: They are still holding up great after many months
customer_reviews.text: There was concern these would rip to shreds after freeway driving in short time. They are still holding up great after many months. My kids love not having the sun in their eyes and keeps the back seat cooler. It's also super nice being able to roll down windows with the shades in place. The only negative is it makes the blind spot in the driver's side a little harder to check (the passenger side isn't too bad since it's a better angle), but it's not enough if an issue to drop the rating. I'm very happy with my purchase and have had strangers ask where I got them.
customer_reviews.author: D. Jelte

customer_reviews.title: Love them !
customer_reviews.text: Super easy installation. Great coverage. I have them on both of my cars. They are the only ones my kids won’t take off and they don’t fall off. I agree with the other reviewers when it comes to the blind spot on your left. I just have gotten used to it and pay extra attention before switching lanes.
customer_reviews.author: Calimom

customer_reviews.title: Mosquito & bug repellent
customer_reviews.text: Well a week in so far so good. I needed something to combat against the mosquitos here in Texas during heat. Ran across this product & I'm very pleased. I have very dark tint also & this makes even more dark..... Nice..... Extra protection against Texas heat. Does make difficult at night looking out blind side but no complaining here. Just don't roll down if it's raining or rained and has not fully dried. I made that accidentally mistake. Mosquito repellent check. Sun protection check. Price check.
customer_reviews.author: Corey Howse

customer_reviews.title: Likely to leave stains on car paint
customer_reviews.text: From reading another review for a similar product, I went ahead and tested the shades to see if they would leave stains when wet. Yes, they will do just that. Even after a few tests, there is still this dark green liquid that comes out when wringing the shades. If these never get wet, you're ok, but if they do, they will likely leave stains on your car's paint. I would go with window tint or an interior roll-up shade instead to be safe.
customer_reviews.author: GP

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!!
customer_reviews.text: We love this SO much! My husband was really skeptical when I ordered it, but it is perfect! We bought it for our child in the back seat. We live in Florida and the sun is always in his face when we’re in the car. We were so tired of the mini roll up ones that always fall off or break. This one is perfect and not near as tacky looking as we feared. We like to call it a Panty-hose for the car 😂
customer_reviews.author: Kaitlin Stence

customer_reviews.title: Not for Subaru Foresters
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to receive these screens. I’ll be taking a cross country road trip through the desert this summer and wanted something to protect from bugs when I sleep In my car and to protect my puppy dog from the harsh rays. I have a 2018 Subaru Forester and these are just a bit too small/short. I’ll be sending them back and ordering larger ones. Yes I measured, but still too small. Very nice and they feel sturdy. Would recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Ezer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic shades!!
customer_reviews.text: I frequently drive a toddleraround for work and she's recently become ridiculously sensitive to light in the car. The even out the light, make it dark enough for her to nap, and help reduce hollering on long drives. Dark enough to need removal at night.
customer_reviews.author: TallAsTwoTrees

customer_reviews.title: Keeps the sun out
customer_reviews.text: Our 2 year old hated the sun getting in his eyes and would not wear sunglasses or a hat. We had previous sun shield that used the suction cups and they never worked well and would not cover the full window. With this one you get full coverage and you can still roll down your window. They are great and really darken the back seat.
customer_reviews.author: Seth Jaco

customer_reviews.title: Holy hell
customer_reviews.text: There's so much to prepare when getting ready for a baby that I didn't want to spend almost $200 in putting tints on my car, so I bought this instead and it's amazing! I have a Ford Fiesta and although it's a little slouchy inside (I used pins to make sure it doesn't flap outside, so it stays flat on the outside) or completely blocks out the sun! Which was perfect for when my son came into this world this last Wednesday. He's so small and tiny, I'm glad I didn't add the terrible sweating he would have had in the car without this!
customer_reviews.author: Jasmine

customer_reviews.title: Nice to use for anything! But it helped me with a broken window!:)
customer_reviews.text: My car window got stuck down and I dont have much money to get it fixed right now so I originally trash bagged it but when my child was in the car the wind and trash bag made such noise she hated car rides, plus it was kind of embarrassing. SO, these were PERFECT to put over the trash bag and now no noise and the window looks nice like it isnt stuck down lol.
customer_reviews.author: Pandabliss

customer_reviews.title: Socks for your vehicles window
customer_reviews.text: This product did its job which is to protect from the sun and iv rays. This product is super simple to install. That is all I like about this product. If your not careful this item can really damage your vehicle doors weather stripping. Be aware that’s all I am saying besides that enjoy.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Blocks sun and heat
customer_reviews.text: Love this! The medium size fits perfect over my 2006 Toyota Highlander. It helps keep the heat and sun out. The only drawback is that I can not see very well when I look back over my left shoulder while driving. I can still see fine when looking to the right, but the blind spot on the left is pretty significant.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: UNIVERSAL SIZE IS TOO BIG FOR OUR CHEVY IMPALA LTZ.
customer_reviews.text: I asked the mfg. if the smaller size would fit my vehicle, they advised to buy this later size.... now I wish I had bought the smaller size. It fits very loosely on the rear windows of the Chevy Impala LTZ. We need to remove it we are driving because it flaps in the wind due to the large size. It does a good job of keeping away the sun from the back seats while it is sitting in our driveway though.
customer_reviews.author: C. Peters

customer_reviews.title: Not an exact fit but works great!
customer_reviews.text: I have a 2012 Honda Civic. The small/medium size window cover is still a bit large and baggy in some places, especially around the top of the window, which makes sense since it’s intended for a range of cars and apparently my windows are on the smaller size. But the elastic at the bottom holds the covers on snugly and they do exactly what I purchased them for, which is shade my baby in the back seat. For the price, I would purchase again!
customer_reviews.author: Margaret DeGraw

customer_reviews.title: My husband literally laughed out loud when he saw this ...
customer_reviews.text: My husband literally laughed out loud when he saw this straight out of the box. To his surprise it fit well and was not baggy nor did it flap about in the wind. I initially had my doubts as well but it turns out it does its job. However be extremely wary of your blind spots while driving.
customer_reviews.author: liz7435

customer_reviews.title: A little dark...
customer_reviews.text: I live in Vegas so it is hot here in the summer....and we'll sunny...I got these so my new born would have sun protection. That he definitely has! I almost feel like they are too dark sometimes. I can see through them but not really well especially when it is dark outside. I do love how easy they go on and come off....and I can wash them in the washing machine which is nice!
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Gets wet on the inside and big
customer_reviews.text: These were a bit big for my windows so there is some extra fabric at the top that flaps around when it's wet. I have noticed that the band at the bottom gets wet on the inside when it rains but not to the point of dripping. They work well to block the sun but it does hinder viewing over your shoulder.
customer_reviews.author: Sara Sims

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! These came in just before we left to run errands. I had them opened and installed within 2 minutes. It just slipped right over the car door. The material is very soft - I wish they made pantyhose with this material! It was very sunny the day we got them in and for once my daughter did not complain about the “hot bright sun.” I think she likes them too. Great product! I’m going to recommend them to anyone looking
customer_reviews.author: Krista B

customer_reviews.title: Good quality!
customer_reviews.text: These have been so convenient for my ‘16 Jetta. Only con is that there’s extra material so I have to fold it under the bottom or else it’s not tight & makes car rides in the highway very noisy. You can still hear it when it’s tight to the window but it’s not nearly as bad. I’ve. Even after car washes, these have held up well and made it less of a hassle than tinting windows.
customer_reviews.author: Jos Esp

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for bright day
customer_reviews.text: This helps so much. Now that our twins are forward facing in their seats I wanted something that would block out the light for their sensitive eyes (micro-preemies that have had LASIK surgery). This does the job so well. Putting it on and off is easy. The only 'issue' is with the the blind spot when driving - I have to be extra careful and really make sure when I drive. It is that good.
customer_reviews.author: Shyflame

customer_reviews.title: Creates blindspots
customer_reviews.text: Fit perfectly on the rear doors of my 2006 Prius. Just a few downfalls keep this from being a 5 star. First: it creates blindspots; it's hard to see through when looking back from the driver's seat. Second: if left on in the rain moisture wicks inside the car making everything the kids car seats damp. Otherwise I'm very satisfied with this product. I just wasn't expecting that I'd need to remove it at night or when it's going to rain.
customer_reviews.author: Denise

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't fit Suburban but great product and company
customer_reviews.text: Due to me posting about not fitting my truck this company contacted me because I wasn't happy with their product and offered me a refund. They followed up with me and that is really good customer service. Please give them a chance if you have a smaller vehicle that these shades would fit. It truly is a nice product just doesn't fit my vehicle. I have a 2014 Chevy Suburban and it doesn't fit the windows, not long enough. Otherwise if it fits it seems like a good product.
customer_reviews.author: SDH

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for a relentless sun
customer_reviews.text: Here is Florida the sun would bake my child’s car seat to the point of possibly burning her, even through my (dark but in legal limits) tinted windows. This screen is easy to install, still allows my child to put the window down and stay shaded and even helps prevent her from putting stuff out the window lol. It did take a little getting use to for driving with them and seeing out my back windows, but once I adjusted to the change, I see just fine through them. I would buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

product_meta.title: Uarter Universal Car Rear Side Window Baby Kid Pet Breathable Sun Shade Mesh Backseat (2 Pcs) Fits Most Small and Medium Cars
feature_bullets: In order to MEET the Needs of more Customers-- We have 2 size M and L, so it would be more appropriate. The size range of M is: 23.7"-38"; the size range of L is: 24.4"-40.2" Before you buy, you need to actually measure your window size, and then choose one size you need. Do not hesitate, Click ☆ Add to Cart button NOW!

They Create A Comfortable Environment for You and Your Care-- 100% covering the rear side window then provides maximum shading protection for you and your family, as well as lowering the temperature in the car. When you go out or on the trip, you can better enjoying the music, movies, video games, reading and food, you and your children, parents, friends, pets can be more relaxed, more comfortable. Even when parked!

Simple Installation--The sunshade curtain is made of elastic material, easy to wear, like the picture show, step by step, do not need any sucker or paste, high elasticity, completely covering the side rear window. At the same time, you do not need to worry about; children will be considered them off in the process of driven. Convenient, safe and practical.
